title: Animal Farm
author: george-orwell
summary: A satirical allegory of the Russian Revolution and Stalinism, told through a farm where animals overthrow their human masters only to see the pigs become tyrants. One of the most influential works of political fiction.

attribution.note: Book data from Open Library (openlibrary.org), part of Internet Archive.

description: Animal Farm is a brilliant political satire and a powerful and affecting story of revolutions and idealism, power and corruption. 'All animals are equal. But some animals are more equal than others.' Mr Jones of Manor Farm is so lazy and drunken that one day he forgets to feed his livestock. The ensuing rebellion under the leadership of the pigs Napoleon and Snowball leads to the animals taking over the farm.
